content: Then I raised my eyes and looked, and behold, a man with a measuring line in his hand.
So I said, “Where are you going?”And he said to me, “To measure Jerusalem, to see what  its width and what  its length.”
And there  the angel who talked with me, going out; and another angel was coming out to meet him,
who said to him, “Run, speak to this young man, saying: ‘Jerusalem shall be inhabited  towns without walls, because of the multitude of men and livestock in it.
For I,’ says the , ‘will be a wall of fire all around her, and I will be the glory in her midst.’ ”
Future Joy of Zion and Many Nations
“Up, up! Flee from the land of the north,” says the ; “for I have spread you abroad like the four winds of heaven,” says the .
“Up, Zion! Escape, you who dwell with the daughter of Babylon.”
For thus says the  of hosts: “He sent Me after glory, to the nations which plunder you; for he who touches you touches the apple of His eye.
For surely I will shake My hand against them, and they shall become spoil for their servants. Then you will know that the  of hosts has sent Me.
“Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion! For behold, I am coming and I will dwell in your midst,” says the .
“Many nations shall be joined to the  in that day, and they shall become My people. And I will dwell in your midst. Then you will know that the  of hosts has sent Me to you.

Be silent, all flesh, before the , for He is aroused from His holy habitation!”
